<s> When it comes to selecting an investment platform, which one do you think stands out in terms of its user interface, educational resources, and the diversity of available investment products? The choice may not be so obvious.For 33-year-old Hong Kong resident Kwok Wai Yeung, it's easy. “Because of the good user experience and the good diversity of products, I think HKEx InvestSmart is the best online brokerage service in Hong Kong,” he says.InvestSmart is the digital platform of Hong Kong Exchanges and Clearing, which is the Hong Kong-based exchange for stocks, bonds, and other financial products. It offers investors both Hong Kong-based products and those available in the mainland.Having spent about eight years working in financial services and eight years studying economics, Yeung has some strong opinions about online trading platforms. “The problem with other online brokerage services is that they do not have a good user interface,” he says.“I know HKEx, so I have some familiarity with HKEx InvestSmart. If I want to compare with other brokerage services, I can use a paper mock trading account to compare, and I can see that the HKEx platform is more user-friendly and has better resources for newcomers,” says Yeung.“It's very convenient. You just need to log in to your HKEx account online, and you can see all the investment products that you have bought in the past, which is very convenient for you to track your investments and also to see what's the best investment product for you to invest in,” says Yeung.Yeung, who is now a product manager at an investment bank, has been using HKEx's InvestSmart since 2014 and has also referred several friends to use it.One of Yeung's best friends is 31-year-old Liu Jun, who has been a customer of InvestSmart for about a year and a half. Liu is now studying abroad in Canada.“HKEx InvestSmart has a very easy-to-use platform. You can track your investment portfolio easily and you don't need to do a lot of calculations to understand how your investments are performing. You can do it in seconds,” says Liu.Liu, who is an engineer by profession, started using InvestSmart when he realized that he needed to pay more attention to the investments he had been making. “My friends who are traders suggested me to open an HKEx account, and that's how I came across HKEx InvestSmart,” he says.Liu and Yeung have different backgrounds but share similar opinions about HKEx InvestSmart. “HKEx InvestSmart is an excellent product. I can access all the information through their app, and I also get alerts when there are some changes in my investments. It helps me keep an eye on my investments,” says Liu.Besides Hong Kong-based companies, HKEx also provides access to the mainland Chinese A-share market.Liu has purchased a stock in China's A-share market through HKEx InvestSmart. “If I didn't have HKEx InvestSmart, it would be difficult for me to invest in the Chinese A-share market. But through InvestSmart, I could easily purchase and sell shares. There are also analyst reports on the Chinese A-share market, which is very useful,” he says.While Liu has been using HKEx InvestSmart for a short time, Yeung is already well-versed in the features.“For people who are just entering the investment field, HKEx InvestSmart can provide a good learning platform for them. As for me, I'm not the type of person who loves to read so much, but if I want to understand the products more, I can easily check all the details,” says Yeung.“I believe that HKEx InvestSmart can be more user-friendly and more intuitive to new users, especially if they're not familiar with the financial sector. I think they need to make it easier for users to access more information on the financial sector, which will help investors have more confidence in investing and make them more comfortable with their investment portfolio,” he adds.This article originally appeared in the South China Morning Post, and was written by Nicole Chen.The information provided in this document is for reference only and does not constitute any investment recommendation or advice to buy, sell or hold any specific security or to adopt any specific investment strategy. The information provided herein should not be considered a solicitation to deal in any investment product or to participate in any investment strategy discussed herein. The document may not be reproduced or distributed in whole or in part without the prior written consent of HKEX. The document does not take into account any investor's investment objectives, particular needs or financial situation. Investors should refer to the relevant offering documents for further details including product features and risk factors and consult professional investment advisors for appropriate advice before making investments.</s>

<s> When it comes to selecting an investment platform, which one do you think stands out in terms of its user interface, educational resources, and the diversity of available investment products?In a recent study conducted by LendEDU, a financial education website, the top contender was Charles Schwab. With an overall score of 85, it stood out from its competitors in many respects.Let’s go over the main features of Schwab’s platform that make it one of the best in the industry.For the most part, Charles Schwab has the typical types of investments available. It gives you access to stocks, ETFs, bonds, and mutual funds. You can also purchase CDs, margin loans, and IRAs.What makes this brokerage platform unique is the sheer number of no-fee mutual funds that it offers. In total, you have access to 123 low-cost funds. This is especially significant considering that it’s not an inexpensive service. You’re looking at paying a minimum of $4.95 per online equity trade or $0.65 per online options trade.Schwab offers a pretty robust selection of educational resources to its users. On top of the fact that you can get real-time advice from professionals, you can also find all sorts of helpful articles and videos on the Schwab Resource Center.With an investment app, you can do a lot of things through your smartphone, such as placing trades, monitoring your portfolio, and more. With Schwab, the app is very intuitive. You can find it on Google Play and the App Store, and it offers a great range of features.This is another aspect of Schwab’s platform where it stands out. Its user interface is modern, clean, and quite intuitive. You can easily find the assets you want to purchase or sell, and you can do so in a variety of different ways.A lot of people feel that Schwab’s platform has too many options, but there’s something to be said about having a wide variety of services and tools available to you. Not only does it give you the option of doing things on your own, but it can also be quite helpful when you run into certain roadblocks.What are the Downsides of Charles Schwab?While Schwab has a lot going for it, it’s not without its problems. For one, it can be expensive to use. This is especially true for frequent traders who are looking to buy and sell stocks and ETFs on a regular basis. If you don’t want to make the minimum monthly contribution of $2,500 to a brokerage account, you’ll end up paying a fee of $100 each month.Another thing you need to watch out for is the commissions. Schwab charges $4.95 per online trade and $0.65 per options trade. These fees can add up quickly, especially when you’re trading frequently. You might be better off looking for another broker if you can’t afford to pay a premium for the level of service and features Schwab offers.Charles Schwab is one of the best investment platforms out there today. Its user interface is modern, its educational resources are second to none, and it has a wide selection of investment products.However, it can be expensive to use, and its fees can add up quickly. If you’re not looking to make a lot of trades, you may be better off looking for a different brokerage platform.With that said, Schwab’s platform is still one of the best in the business, so if you’re looking for an investment platform that gives you access to a wide range of services and tools, it’s definitely worth considering.https://www.charles schwab.com/</s>
